item.title: About
item.description: I was born in the 80’s in a mid-size town in Wisconsin. I feel like my start was quite unassuming. My family had a heavy work ethic and would unwind in true Wisconsin fashion at the end of each week. I spent many of my earlier days playing on or around the Chippewa river. This is where I learned to waterski and enjoy the outdoors. I worked hard through my high school years to the point where I dropped some of my extra curricular activities.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Peer Reviewed Arts J, Mahlandt E, Gr√∂nloh M, Schimmel L, Noordstra I, Gordon E, van Steen A, Tol S, Walzog B, van Rijssel J, Nolte M, Postma M, Khuon S, Heddleston J, Wait E, Chew T, Winter M, Montanez E, Goedhart J, van Buul J: Endothelial Junctional Membrane Protrusions Serve As Hotspots for Neutrophil Transmigration . eLife 2021. Moore A, Coscia S, Simpson C, Ortega F, Wait E, Heddleston J, Nirschl J, Obara C, Guedes-Dias P, Boecker C, Chew T, Theriot J, Lippincott-Schwartz J, Holzbaur E: Actin cables and comet tails organize mitochondrial networks in mitosis .
